ygData.subject: Re: Journal Search
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Chris, it s been a while!  I m surprised you ve only found journals or conferences accepting up to 4 pages.  What journals and conferences were you looking

Hi Chris, it's been a while!  I'm surprised you've only found journals
or conferences accepting up to 4 pages.  What journals and conferences
were you looking at?

As far as I know, almost every journal and/or conference I've seen
accepts longer papers than that.  Most conferences, such as GECCO
accept 8 page two-column formatted papers.  Journals usually accept
papers up to 40 or so pages long.  For example, your topic would go
nicely in Evolutionary Computation journal, Artificial Life journal,
or IEEE Transactions in Evolutionary Computation.  It may also fit in
more general ML journals such as JRML.  There should be plenty of
venues to which you can submit.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Chris Christenson <cpchristenson@y...>
wrote:
> Hello all,
> 
> I've recently completed my Master's Thesis on the
> evolution of learning neural networks.  I am currently
> searching for a journal or conference to submit it to.
>  The problem is that I can't seem to find journals
> that accept papers longer than 4 pages.
> 
> Has anyone heard of any journals or conferences
> accepting long papers?
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> -Chris Christenson
